issues.title: Define SOLID-aligned Python package structure
issues.body:
Create the repository layout and initial module stubs following SOLID principles.

**Description**

- Add `src/<package>/` with domain-driven subpackages.
- Provide public API surface (`__init__.py`) and module stubs.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `src/<package>/` exists with at least 3 modules representing clear responsibilities.
- Public API surface is documented in `README` stub.
- Package imports without runtime errors (`python -c "import <package>"`).

issues.title: Configure pyproject.toml and commit lockfile
issues.body:
Configure project build and dependency management and commit the lockfile to enable reproducible builds.

**Description**

- Choose packaging tool per ADR-001 (Poetry or setuptools) and add `pyproject.toml`.
- Pin tooling and runtime dependencies and commit the lockfile.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `pyproject.toml` committed and valid.
- `poetry.lock` or equivalent lockfile committed.
- `python -m build` produces identical artifacts on CI and locally for the same lockfile.

issues.title: Implement linting and formatting (ruff + black)
issues.body:
Add and configure ruff and black, and enforce them in CI and pre-commit.

**Description**

- Add ruff config and black settings.
- Wire checks into pre-commit and CI.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `pyproject.toml` or config files include ruff/black settings.
- `pre-commit` configured to run black and ruff locally.
- CI PR checks run ruff + black and block merge on violations.

issues.title: Add type checking with mypy
issues.body:
Integrate mypy type checking and enforce in CI to ensure typing discipline.

**Description**

- Add mypy config and type hints to public API stubs.
- Run mypy as part of PR checks.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `mypy.ini` or equivalent committed.
- No type-check errors for the committed codebase in CI.
- Mypy job included in PR workflow and blocks merge on failure.

issues.title: Add unit test framework and coverage baseline
issues.body:
Configure pytest and coverage, add baseline unit tests for core modules and generate coverage reports in CI.

**Description**

- Configure `pytest` and `coverage.py`.
- Implement baseline tests for critical units.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- Tests run locally with `pytest` and in CI.
- Coverage report generated in CI and uploaded as artifact.
- Baseline tests exist and exercise core modules; target coverage baseline recorded (goal â‰¥ 80%).

issues.title: Integrate security scanning (bandit + dependency scan)
issues.body:
Add static analysis (bandit) and dependency scanning to CI to detect SAST issues and vulnerable packages.

**Description**

- Configure bandit to run in CI.
- Add dependency scanning step (safety or GitHub SCA) with threshold blocking CRITICAL issues.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- Bandit job present in PR workflow and produces reports.
- Dependency scanner runs and produces alerts on vulnerable deps.
- CI fails on CRITICAL severity findings as configured.

issues.title: Create PR checks workflow (GitHub Actions)
issues.body:
Implement `.github/workflows/pr-checks.yml` that runs formatting, linting, type checks, tests, coverage, and security scans across a Python matrix.

**Description**

- Add reusable jobs for each check and run on PR and push events.
- Configure matrix for supported Python versions.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `pr-checks.yml` exists and is triggered by PRs.
- All jobs complete successfully for baseline commit.
- Status checks are named and can be selected in branch protection rules.

issues.title: Finalize semantic versioning ADR and minimal automation
issues.body:
Decide on versioning policy (ADR-002) and add minimal automation for version bumps/tags.

**Description**

- Create ADR-002 documenting conventional commits vs tag-based approach.
- Add a simple workflow or script to create version tags following the decided policy.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- ADR-002 committed under `ADRs/` with clear rules.
- A script or workflow exists to perform a dry-run version bump and tag creation.
- Versioning approach validated with a test tag creating a draft release (dry-run).

issues.title: Add initial release workflow (dry-run staging builds)
issues.body:
Create `release.yml` to build artifacts in a hermetic container and run full test suite but not publish to production yet.

**Description**

- Build wheel + sdist in CI container.
- Run integration/smoke tests and produce artifacts.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `release.yml` runs on manual dispatch and tag events in dry-run mode.
- Artifacts are produced and stored as CI artifacts.
- No credentials required to run dry-run build.

issues.title: Create CONTRIBUTING.md
issues.body:
Document contributor workflow, PR expectations, local dev setup, and pre-commit usage.

**Description**

- Include development steps, how to run tests locally, commit conventions, and how to run pre-commit.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `CONTRIBUTING.md` present at repo root and references pre-commit hooks.
- Contains steps to run tests and lint locally.
- Linked from README.

issues.title: Create documentation skeleton (MkDocs or Sphinx)
issues.body:
Add docs scaffolding and initial pages for usage, API reference placeholder, and contribution guide.

**Description**

- Choose MkDocs or Sphinx (per ADR-001 or team preference).
- Add docs config, `index.md`, and API placeholder.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `docs/` contains config and an `index.md` landing page.
- Local build of docs succeeds (`mkdocs build` or `sphinx-build`).
- CI step to build docs is present (optional preview).

issues.title: Add minimum ADR set and commit to /ADRs
issues.body:
Create and commit ADR-001 through ADR-005 covering packaging, versioning, artifact registry, signing, and security scanning.

**Description**

- Write ADRs with rationale and chosen option.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `ADRs/ADR-001.md` .. `ADRs/ADR-005.md` exist and are linked from README.
- Each ADR includes decision, context, consequences, and status.

issues.title: Configure pre-commit hooks for local enforcement
issues.body:
Add pre-commit configuration that runs black, ruff, mypy, and pytest (fast checks) locally before commit.

**Description**

- Add `.pre-commit-config.yaml` and document installation steps.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `pre-commit` config committed.
- Pre-commit installation documented in CONTRIBUTING.md.
- Hooks run and prevent commits when checks fail.

issues.title: Update README with usage, standards, and links
issues.body:
Refresh README to reflect current standards, development steps, and links to docs/ADRs/RUNBOOK.

**Description**

- Add short sections: overview, install, develop, tests, contributing, license.

**Acceptance Criteria**

- `README.md` updated and contains links to `CONTRIBUTING.md`, `ADRs/`, and `RUNBOOK.md` placeholder.
- README includes badge placeholders for CI and coverage.
